Updated November     pm



Three of the worlds top rowing crews are set to descend upon the Montlake Cut on Saturday as Washington hosts the thirty-second annual Windermere Cup marking the official start to boating season in the Northwest PERIOD

Mens crew will face the University of British Columbia and  British National Champion Oxford Brookes University in a race head coach Michael Callahan expects to be one for the ages. the women will race against the Dutch National Team a crew that finished sixth in both the  Rio Olympics and  World Championships PERIOD

The Windermere Cup has always been highly regarded for the topnotch competition that it draws each year PERIOD The event began in  after a Seattle Times columnist complained about the lack of adequate competition for the Huskies PERIOD

Windermere Real Estate founder and UW graduate John Jacobi volunteered to sponsor the event and the Windermere Cup was born PERIOD

That year Washington hosted the Soviet Union PERIOD Given the societal context of the time  the United States and the USSR took turns boycotting the others Olympic Games earlier that decade as the Cold War dragged on  the visit by the Soviet crew is considered one of the biggest events in the history of Seattle rowing PERIOD

While both the Husky men and women crews lost by sizable margins the Cup was quickly cemented as a major rowing event PERIOD Washington has raced crews from countries like New Zealand China Australia Great Britain and Egypt PERIOD

The UW men enjoyed a stretch of  consecutive wins in the Windermere Cup from  to  PERIOD The streak was snapped in  when the UW . finished third behind the University of Victoria . and the Croatian Olympic Team . pERIOD

Womens crew has had similar success winning its past  Windermere Cup races PERIOD Its last loss came in  when Russia defeated the Huskies by more than six seconds PERIOD

Last year both crews were dominant against the Shanghai HighPerformance Rowing teams PERIOD The men . finished nearly  seconds ahead of the Chinese crew . pERIOD The women cleared the  second mark finishing with a time of . to the Chinese crews . pERIOD

Saturdays exhibitions will serve as the Huskies final tuneup before the Pac12 Championships PERIOD The collegiate races begin at  a.m PERIOD with the womens varsity  PERIOD The final races of the day will decide the Windermere Cup victors with the womens  kicking off at  a.m PERIOD and the mens  at  a.m PERIOD A complete schedule of the days events can be found here PERIOD

Reach contributing writer Jordan Duncan at sportsdailyuw.com PERIOD Twitter JordanDuncan43
